website_summaries.verdict: A middle-of-the-road surge protector that lacks additional ports and has just 6 outlets. The swivel design and low-profile make it worth considering.
pros: Wall-hugging fit works in tight spaces
Has a sturdy build and is 2,100-joule rated
cons: Tends to fall out of an outlet, especially when multiple items are plugged into it
Outlets are fairly close to each other

customer_reviews.title: When I pull a plug out the entire thing likes to come out of the wall outlet.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these to be used in different room. It's nice to have the swivel function - makes it easier to plug in more things. The surge protectiion light is on so I hope it's working correctly for that. However, whenever I go to pull a plug out, the entire thing likes to come out of the wall outlet along with the plug I'm pulling. The last multi-outlet I had like this screwed into the middle screw hole of the wall outlet preventing this from happening. There needs to be something like that on these. I would have given 5 stars for this item but can't because it comes out of the wall outlet so easily.
customer_reviews.author: mcadwellTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design. Pulls away from Wall.  Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Design is very poor! No screw to hold square against wall. When multiple outlets are required, it is reasonable to believe that there will be extra weight tugging at outlet. This pulls away from wall, and doesn't stay in the outlet. I wanted to return it since it does not function as described. Disclosing that the weight will pull it away from the wall is critical to anyone purchasing a device that is suppose to assist in excess plugs. The company wanted me to pay for the shipping... Not cool!!! Don't buy this product. Stay away from Globe Electric products.
customer_reviews.author: Sese S.

customer_reviews.title: STUPIDLY POWERED BY THE WRONG OUTLET!
customer_reviews.text: STUPIDLY POWERED BY WRONG OUTLET! This otherwise-nicely designed plug outlet is powered by the LOWER outlet. You cannot flip it over, and the LOWER outlet is the one that is controlled by a switch (if any outlet is controlled by a switch.) Now who wants six outlets controlled by a single switch?! I just cannot fathom how the designers did not know how US outlets are organized, nor can I imagine if they knew this, why they would choose that outlet to power their strip!!! seems just dumb. but I would love to hear if someone can explain why in some other circumstance one would want this.
customer_reviews.author: D. Oblinger

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. It falls out of the outlet every couple ...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. It falls out of the outlet every couple of days. Not sure why they didn't make 2 actual outlet sets of metal prongs on this. The plastic prongs on the top set are too small and do not fit into the outlet, causing this to simply fall out of the top socket every day. I threw it in a drawer and am no longer using it. Disappointing. Not sure how anyone else is using it (I used it on multiple outlets with the same result). Poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Glass

customer_reviews.title: OUT AGAIN!
customer_reviews.text: WISH I HAD PAID MORE ATTENTION TO SOME OF THE EARLIER REVIEWS. THE GLOBE IS VERY WELL MADE ONLY PROBLEM IS THAT IS WILL NOT STAY PLUGGED INTO THE EXISTING WALL OUTLET. TRIED REMOVING THE FACE PLATE FROM THE WALL OUTLET, STILL THE GLOBE WOULDN'T STAY IN. EVEN TRIED SOME DOUBLE SIDED TAPE BUT THE GLOBE STILL FELL OUT OF THE WALL OUTLET. LOOKS GREAT JUST DOESN'T WORK!!!
customer_reviews.author: je77489

customer_reviews.title: Bumer
customer_reviews.text: I believe this was my second purchase of this item... I had the origional for some time, I love the ability to utilize plugs with limitted space. However, I often had to work on keeping adapter in wall socket. I realized only when I attempted to use my new purchase why the origional stopped working in the first place. The plastic prongs which secure the plug in place did not line up. It took my husband several hours to remove plastic from the outlet (wish I'd taken a pic) and when we attempted to utilize the new wall adapter one of the prongs broke off... could not line up so am returning... dissappointed... going to look for something similar
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne H. LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: This surge protector has been the greatest thing next to retirement
customer_reviews.text: This surge protector has been the greatest thing next to retirement! I've purchased two of them and plan on two more. My house is old and sockets are limited. I have a lot of things to plug in until the day comes when lamps and TVs are wireless. Plus, they are space savers! The folding outward flattens against the wall and I can move my TV table back at least two more inches! Thank you for this great invention!
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: grandaughter
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for granddaughter who has strings of led lights around architectural points in her room. She thrilled with it as no longer needs to use extension cords. I have two or three of these one near my chair for lamps, computer, and other items. As well as one in my kitchen for my electrical appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Lainie

customer_reviews.title: Didnt space save like I hoped.
customer_reviews.text: It does not work with netgear router plug size. I thought this would be perfect for a hand sized rectangular plug that was sticking out too far for our piano to sit flush against the wall. If the plugs themselves were turned sideways instead of ventricle it would have worked. So it does not save space for all plugs. Works best with regular plugs that aren't large like AC adapters. I ended up just running the powercord from the router around the door frame to the next room and plugging it in in the other room with a drop cord so my piano can be flush against the wall in the other room. Cool idea but didnt work.
customer_reviews.author: LINDSEY

customer_reviews.title: Probably works fine. Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Probably works fine. Easy to install. Just plug it in. But that big $ connected equipment limited warranty is practically useless. Why? You must fill out a tiny piece of paper and mail it to Montreal Canada. For each item you want to "insure" you have to supply (in infinitely tiny print) 1. The System Equipment, 2. the Make or Model, 3. the serial number, 4. the purchase date, 5. Whether the item is under a service contract or other warranty. I would possibly supply this minutia on line, but fill out the paper and mail it in? Never
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best design ever!
customer_reviews.text: I put this in a place that was hard to reach and caused me no end of problems when I needed the outlet to plug in something like my crockpot. I would have to unplug something I used all the time, like the toaster, to plug in the crockpot, and reverse the process when I was done. Now I keep the stuff that needs to be plugged in all the time, like the toaster which I use often, on the far side, leaving the outlets on the near side available to once-in-a-while usage. Brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Good....but.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived with one of the dummy plug-in prongs broken off. I needed to glue it back on. It wasn't enough of an issue to feel the need to return it but they need to package that area a little better to protect those prongs. Other than that, I am happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Terrible - falls out of the wall outlet constantly.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this. It's meant to go in an outlet - the top outlet is just plastic prongs meant to hold the outlet in place while the bottom outlet is the actual metal pronged piece. This outlet DOES NOT STAY IN THE WALL. The top plastic prongs do absolutely nothing to hold the outlet in place, it falls out constantly, leaning out of the wall, half the time the bottom metal prongs get so tilted out that they stop conducting electricity.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Totally utilitarian but a perfect solution in a plugged in world
customer_reviews.text: This is a repeat purchase of this item. In our electronic world there are just never enough plug ins. I use these at home and now I’m using them in our Montana vacation rental. There are just enough outlets in this to provide all the electric needle for the bedroom side tables for alarm clock, 2 bedside lamps, a Nightlight and still have two free plug ins. I have used the rotating part at home behind bookcases and works great for those slimline applications. Would recommend, would buy again, great Christmas stocking stuffer item.
customer_reviews.author: DebbsSeattle

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from these
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but really,really poor execution. I unfortunately bought two of these. And I’m not at all happy with this purchase. The problem is as many reviews have stated “they do not want to stay on the wall” the plastic dummy “stabilizer” plugs on the back broke off almost immediately, and you have to use both hands when plugging or unplugging other items into it . This has become such a pain that I am now in the process of replacing both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Experience is the best teacher.

customer_reviews.title: Such a great solution!
customer_reviews.text: Along with the use of some cable tape, this has allowed me to really tidy up the cables under my desk, all whilst providing far more practicality. My one small qualm is that I wish it didn't have the lights on the front - they're really bright, and even several layers of cable tape won't abate them. But other than that, I think this is a very well thought out design that brilliantly solves a common problem.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: As advertised... PERFECT.
customer_reviews.text: This just freed up a LOT of outlets! Nice and secure.... not going to fall out without being yanked out. For the guy that said ALL US switchable outlets are on the bottom? Wrong. They can be either. I have one on the top in my condo. Excellent purchase 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: rjk

customer_reviews.title: Great!...almost
customer_reviews.text: Simply plug it into the existing single outlet and it is installed and ready for use. I got this for the microwave in the kitchen so that the cord would not be stretched out over the counter. It really is a space saver. What? Why only four stars you ask? It really needs a hole in the center to put the cover plate screw to keep it from moving. After repeated in and out with the blender, mixer and other normal kitchen usage, it tends to pull away from the wall. I did not care for that feature as much as the swiveling. I did purchase a second for my mothers' fireplace blower and it really looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Blue-Collar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product and looks good!
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's on the wall and I dont have a mess of cords on the ground going into a surge protector. Its slick and sits close to the wall. Great product. A good thing to know: if you have old outlets in your wall that do not hold plugs well you will want to replace your old outlet (which you should do anyway for safty purposes) otherwise it will fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize it only utilizes the bottom outlet of a duplex recepticle upon purchase. The top part of the plug is just plastic inserts, and they do nothing to hold the thing in place. It falls off the wall when cords are plugged in. Major fire hazard. I also seriously question the output rating claimed on the packaging considering similar 6 outlet plugs with identical ratings utilize BOTH outlets in a duplex recepticle.
customer_reviews.author: Big Ry

customer_reviews.title: Agree with most reviews
customer_reviews.text: I agree with most reviews on the product. Because the bottom prong is plastic, it is prone to pulling out of the wall. I do not experience as much frustration as other users because the items I have plugged into the device, stay plugged in like my Dyson charger and desk laptop charger. I would not recommend if you are using it to plug and unplug things from out of the socket.
customer_reviews.author: Wiseblue

customer_reviews.title: Falls off of horizontal outlets
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for a vertical double outlet and it worked well. So I bought a second one, however I was ultimately not so happy with it. The second one was for a horizontal double outlet. There's no anchor screw, so the unit falls under the weight of any added plugs. Avoid buying this for horizontal outlets. This could / should be designed better.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for my applications...I now own FIVE of them.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT. after being hit by lightening at home...and losing the only thing not plugged into a surge/outlet (a junky little TV)....ordered one for HOME. PERFECT - swivel feature is REALLY nice - keeps your cords "flatter" against the wall. THEN - I ordered TWO MORE for the SHOP (work). THEN - I just ordered TWO MORE for the SHOP (work). I now own 5 :) They're perfect for my applications. I might own MORE in the future - would definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Smart, attractive, tidy ... I’m getting more
customer_reviews.text: Smart, attractive, tidy ... I’m getting more. Very low profile. I love that it turns the plugs against the wall. Especially nice for my MacBook transformer, which was hanging out of the outlet into the room. Great for my office where I can now get everything off the floor. And for my entertainment center where I can now push the furniture close the the wall. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: K. Friedrichs

customer_reviews.title: UNstable - very poor design
customer_reviews.text: Although the unit provides additional outlets in adjustable configurations the device is poorly designed and is unstable in the fixture. This could have been easily corrected by including a long central screw that would allow a safe and secure attachment to the junction box. As it is the device pulls out of the socket with the slightest jostling.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Best way to prevent damage to power cords and prevent fires
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the quality, utility, and durability of this pivoting outlet. Allows me to move my couch and hutch all the way back and not damage the power cords by bending the cords back. Great idea with the led lights to get a glimpse of the power status without having to move the furniture out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Skid

customer_reviews.title: Best price for the swivel wall surge protector.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what everyone is complaining about on Amazon about the surge protector not staying in the socket. If it doesn't stay in the socket, it means the wall outlet you're plugging in is worn out. I don't necessarily agree about the design of the unit with the plug being on the bottom and the top being a plastic dummy plug to hold the unit in. It's dumb to be honest. But as for the design, there are multiple brands that offer the same design... and I believe it's the exact same surge protector. Not sure about the internals. The Globe Electric one is by far the cheaper version of all the brands.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: What I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is very good. Arrived on time. The only reason I did not give it a 5 star is because, it wants to pull out of the wall, does not sit tightly. But it works well, Just be careful not to pull of bump. Since mine is behind my bed, it does not really get messed with much. I might consider spreading the connectors out some, see if that helps with the fit. Would recommend this overall.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Davis

customer_reviews.title: as a multi outlet it is a nice size, it fits well behind our tv stand ...
customer_reviews.text: We have not had a power outage yet so the surge protecter has yet to be tested. That being said, as a multi outlet it is a nice size, it fits well behind our tv stand and the swivel feature allows the tv stand to be close to the outlet without preventing cords from fitting (i.e. you can swivel the outlets to the side vs not having room to fit them perpendicular to the wall)
customer_reviews.author: Deanna R.

customer_reviews.title: Fit Perfectly and the Swivel Outlets are a Really Nice Feature
customer_reviews.text: Even with 5-6 cords plugged in, the outlet doesn't lean outward as some have reported. It's rock solid. The swivel feature allows furniture to be placed closer to the wall. I highly recommend this product. We'll hopefully never really know about the surge protection it provides, but that's true of all surge protectors on the market. However, based on the solid design and construction of this outlet, I have faith in the protection it provides.
customer_reviews.author: HSPS2

customer_reviews.title: Poor/Cheap Design Leads to Problems
customer_reviews.text: Poor design may lead to problems. Here are the issues. First, the top plug that you plug into your outlet is plastic. This is a cheap and poor choice to make. The plastic plug does not hold well at all. As a result if you plug anything into it at all that has any weight (like a regular cord) it will torque the outlet and it will begin to pull away from the wall. This could have been avoided if they had a long screw like most of the other outlets do, but they don't. They are relying on that ONE real plug to hold everything in place. This is a very poor choice.
customer_reviews.author: sbradford

customer_reviews.title: A nice way to protect plugs and transformers
customer_reviews.text: Great option when you have furniture close to the outlet and are concerned about damaging the plug for an appliance, light, etc. We've purchased a few of these now and having the on board surge protector works especially well since surge protectors add even more of an offset and clearance to a receptacle. Good quality and packaged very well, protecting the plug during shipment. Great price from Amazon, they sell for a few more dollars at other sellers. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: ToolMan

customer_reviews.title: After a month of use - I would not recommend at all
customer_reviews.text: Does not have a center mounting screw to secure it to the outlet like so many others do. Top socket is secured with plastic dummy plugs that are not full size causing it to tip forward and slip out of socket. I am constantly having to push it back in after only a few days and only light use. Also, it only draws power from one socket rather than both because the top socket plug is plastic. Not sure if that's safe (6-to-1 power draw). After a month of use - I would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bob & Susan W.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't do much protecting.
customer_reviews.text: I almost lost a TV with this surge protector, didn't do much protecting during our last power outage, dropping it from 4 to 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I've had this almost 4 months now and no amount of double stick heavy duty tape will help this, it will not stay in the wall, its great if your 3 prong outlets are all ground pin on top, otherwise this is a terrible awful product, all it does is fall out of the outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Teej

customer_reviews.title: Built in Surge protection eased my anxiety about many things plugged in to same outlet.
customer_reviews.text: The swivel feature makes it easy to use if reaching behind something, like a sofa. Unit itself a little bulky but turning socket reduces overall if all plugs faced outward without using this device. Very pleased and bought two more for other areas of house, and shop in garage.
customer_reviews.author: Cgeorge1520

customer_reviews.title: Flawed - no provision for securing to wall socket
customer_reviews.text: Normally an outlet expander can be attached to the center of an outlet with a machine screw. This prevents the expander from being pulled out of the wall when electrical plugs are removed. This Globe 6-Outlet Expander offers no method to be secured to the wall outlet. Another minor flaw is the single electrical connection plug - two electrical plugs would be a better.. Otherwise the product is well-made. Great concept, poor design. I didn't bother to test it.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: It is a good product.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product. I love that the panels pivot. The only thing that bothers me is that in my case I can't use the USB ports. My electrical outlets are horizontal and the USB ports of this product fall on the back where I can't reach. It might have helped to mention on the store page the direction of the outlet prongs so regular people like me don't have to find out the hard way. Or maybe have another version of the device where the USB ports are on both sides of it.
customer_reviews.author: VUR

customer_reviews.title: Outlets are different than the pictures
customer_reviews.text: Beware. All the pictures in the description show the outlets as vertical, but what I received has all the outlets rotated 90°, or horizontal. It seems like a quality product, but I cant use it in my space due to the outlets being the wrong direction.
customer_reviews.author: Guitarzan

customer_reviews.title: A surge protector you can plug into from the side
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several of there over the years for most of the plugs in my place if, for no other reason, the sides can swivel, allowing the plugs to stick out to the side rather than the front. When you add to that the surge protection, your devices are protected in several different ways.
customer_reviews.author: Karvin Spurgeon

customer_reviews.title: Good wall plug surge protector, but note size
customer_reviews.text: This will work in standard US outlets, but will not fit properly in GFCI wall plugs, the kind in many kitchens and bathrooms that a reset button.
customer_reviews.author: Macsarcule

customer_reviews.title: This thing is more trouble than it's worth!
customer_reviews.text: This does not screw into the outlet housing and only the bottom part of it is an actual metal outlet, the top part is a plastic filler and it does not hold in the wall! You will never be able to unplug anything one handed without ripping this out of the socket. It sorta sags out of the wall too because the bottom outlet holds in the but top one doesn't. It's a really poor design and the top socket should be metal as well so that it can properly hold onto the wall. Do not waste your time! Get one that screws into the wall!
customer_reviews.author: Koji Kadet

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product for Tight Spaces
customer_reviews.text: Here is a product that works really well! Love the versatility. I will say that you need a fairly tight plug-in for it to stay put. I wish it would have a dummy plug to make it more stable. Otherwise, it works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W

customer_reviews.title: I like this wall surge protector
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for that finally one surge protector that can not be in the way while I plugged everything all at once. I love the swivel rotation outlets and I like that it's connected on the wall instead of it on the floor. I wish I found this earlier in the years so I could have bought these instead of the floor Outlets ones. This is a must have product which I love it
customer_reviews.author: MARANGELY HUERTAS  (Angie)

customer_reviews.title: Warning GFI does not work
customer_reviews.text: Just lost 2 big screen TV'S a Playstation 4 and Laptop when lightning storm was nearby. They do not work. One in bedroom and living both didn't work. Cost me about $2,000.00
customer_reviews.author: Banditt

customer_reviews.title: That's the primary bad part about this
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is bulky as it would for you to just direct plug the outlet. That's the primary bad part about this. And like some people have already mentioned. It's not the most stable thing as the prong on top is fake and shorter than the real prong. It will stay put but it won't stay put firmly. It's slightly wobbly but not enough for the whole thing to discharge. This can change depending on how many outlets you have it plugged.
customer_reviews.author: sbleedavis

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!  Maybe one improvement...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. I can't say that I've seen that it's saved any equipment during a surge, but the swivel feature is great - I have one behind my toaster so that the toaster can fit closer to the wall and all the other plugs (like for the coffee maker) aren't sticking straight out from the wall. Only suggestion is that they add a retaining screw in the center so that the whole fixture is more securely attached to the wall. Every week or so I have to nudge it against the wall a but. I may try some double-sided tape on the back to keep it more snugly against the wall,
customer_reviews.author: Ian McEaghan

customer_reviews.title: I should have listened to my friend, and got ...
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to my friend, and got the one that has to be tightened in the middle with a screw...more secure that way. This would not stay secure in the socket, kept falling out
customer_reviews.author: K. Pope

customer_reviews.title: look for something else - this is junk
customer_reviews.text: junk - broke - defective, first off it doesn't stay on the wall, it's own weight makes it fall out the sockets even when nothing is plugged in. There is no option to screw into wall. and lastly, one of the prongs was snapped, and I hadn't even used it. really, really, really bad all around. completely unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Jam

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: This keeps falling out of the wall once you put 6 things plugged into it. The top plug is just a dummy plug that is too small to fit the receptacle so it starts to tilt and fall out of the wall. VERY dangerous design!
customer_reviews.author: MAShopper

customer_reviews.title: So convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I just want to leave a big thanks to the seller for sending me a new one after my first purchase was damaged. This product works great for outlets that are blocked by furniture. I use this in my bedroom, and it works great! I think this could be a little thinner, because my bed is not as flesh against the wall. This could be due to my bed not having a bed frame, but it works better than it was before. So glad I found this!
customer_reviews.author: Tvan1081

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my third of these adapters. Having furniture sticking way out from the walls if the outlet is behind drives me bonkers. This one only sticks out about 2", and furniture can fit flush up against it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Austin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend. When there is not enough outlet and several cookware needs it. We have microwave, small oven and kettle at one place, and this device do solve the problem. The quality is decent, not cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Perfect behind a headboard.
customer_reviews.text: I have a sleep number bed that requires that a motor be plugged in. Additionally I want to recharge a laptop and a phone on the nightstands. This item allows for six plugs, but most importantly it lets 3 plugs swivel to each side: that means the unit is flat behind my headboard, and charging cords can be run to both sides of the bed. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Travelbug

customer_reviews.title: Love this Swivel Wall Outlet
customer_reviews.text: I love this swivel wall outlet that I bought another one for traveling. I have one right by my bedside for all those gadgets we all have. You know the computer, phones, iPads, etc. Then when I traveled I realized I needed another one so that I can charge all those gadgets in one place. It is a great surge protector. I have not had any problems and we did have a power surge recently. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Drew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent outlet, saves me a ton of space
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these and it is great. Used the swivel and pointed the connectors to the side so that the cables I plug into it don't look like a huge mess sticking right out of the wall. Will buy a again if the need arises, 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Hai Time

customer_reviews.title: Great idea...but would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and have had them for several months and replaced both with the normal, long outlets. If you use all 6 outlets the weight pulls it off the wall. I would NOT buy these again or reccomend them.
customer_reviews.author: kritterkk

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS PICTURED
customer_reviews.text: As you can see, the outlet holes do NOT line up as shown. I ordered this for 'down flag plugs' and it can't work, because the orientation is wrong. BUYER BEWARE. It also ships loose in a bag. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Gaughan

customer_reviews.title: Does not match description
customer_reviews.text: I did not use this product. beware that the website depicts the plugs being vertical, but they are actually horizontal.
customer_reviews.author: Elena T.

customer_reviews.title: Great for behind furniture
customer_reviews.text: These outlets are fantastic. I've purchased three - one behind a chest of drawers and two behind a sectional sofa. Due to the swivel capability of the outlets, I can scoot my furniture much closer to the walls.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: AVOID...DOES NOT WORK.... Plug will not stay in the wall... ,
customer_reviews.text: Read first couple of reviews (BAD)... Not sure how to explain the PROBLEM., but as stated in other reiews the 'plug' DOES NOT STAY IN THE WALL... the 'ground plug' (Center metal 'post') is 'coated' with a plastic (or vinyl??) that makes the weight of any plug 'pull it out' of the wall.... it is ridiculous. DOES NOT WORK...> STAY AWAY from this product ...it is a HUGE WASTE OF MONEY... WORTHLESS
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M D

customer_reviews.title: Great for tight spaces.
customer_reviews.text: I Love this product. I used it behind my bed to take advantage of the sockets there. I plugged it in and haven't looked back. I would definitely recommend to others and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: apyblog

customer_reviews.title: Great Outlet Extender with Surge Protector
customer_reviews.text: The swivel feature on this outlet extender is pretty cool. In addition to increasing the number of outlets (6 vs. the usual 2), the rotating sockets allow you to plug things into tight spaces. There are others just as good for that purpose for less, but this one is more versatile. I also love that it has a built-in surge protector and green and red lights let you know the status.
customer_reviews.author: Cat LadyTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. I had none of the issues some reported with the unit pulling itself from the wall. Five of the six outlets are being used and two of those are power adapters. It cleaned up an area beside the bed that was using a cumbersome outlet strip. Now everything's tucks in back of the nightstand out of view. Nice. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Garner

customer_reviews.title: Space Saver
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I purchased an entertainment cabinet and when we 1st got it and put it in place, it just sat to far away from the wall due to the multi outlet cover I had. Our den is not a big room so every inch I could gain and save was important. I looked on line for answers how to get the cabinet as close as possible to the wall. I was looking into construction as an answer but I definitely didn't want to go in that direction. I Remember seeing a swivel outlet on a TV commercial so I bought this one. It felt as if I gained a foot. Great product I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: JGD

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed. It works great and allowed me to plug in extra sources to the outlet without having to push out the furniture. It looks great and I would definitely purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: I saw this on the internet and clicked on it ...
customer_reviews.text: I saw this on the internet and clicked on it...the only trouble is this isn't what I clicked on...I didn't catch in the description that it was different than what I clicked on....The one I clicked on had usb port for phone and IPad charger on the top.....That is what I thought that I was getting....this works but it isn't what the internet advertised....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Neatness & Tight Spots
customer_reviews.text: This is great to put behind things like entertainment centers, dressers, sofas, etc and not have to plug in a surge protector and have that cord sticking out randomly from behind something with a bunch of stuff plugged into it. With the pieces turned to the side you can plug everything in behind the ffurniture/object and it's much neater.
customer_reviews.author: Just AZK

customer_reviews.title: Would not fit in the electrical socket
customer_reviews.text: It has a regular plug in the back and under it, it has a plastic one , and when you plug it in, the plastic part will not go into the bottom plug in . I broke off the plastic part and now it works
customer_reviews.author: kweise

customer_reviews.title: A great extension cord!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product for awhile now, it's amazing. The turnable ports is extremely helpful for behind couches & tv stands. I strongly recommend this product as an alternative to other extension cords. It works great & I've had no issues with the durability after months of use. A great value for your money!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Rimmer

customer_reviews.title: The 2nd one was great.
customer_reviews.text: First one came damaged, not in shipping but from the looks like it was a return that was passed off as new return - black scrapes on it, and ding in the side of the plastic housing. Returned and second one looks and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Yeaham

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice product and does its job just fine
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice product and does its job just fine, but there are two things wrong with mine. 1. One of the sides is much stiffer than the other and makes a disturbing clicking sound when trying to turn it. 2. It isn't very secure in the outlet. Trying to unplug something will pull the entire unit from the outlet. It also seems to want to tilt downwards over time.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay in....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for the great idea of the side sockets. The sockets themselves worked and swiveled nicely. The problem is the top plug (which is plastic) does not stay in. Every time I came into the room I had to push it back in. It seems like this could be a potential fire hazard. This product could be so much better if both plugs were metal and it had a screw to hold it in place. Great idea but I do not want to chance burning down my house because the plug continually comes out. I returned the ones I purchases and will keep looking for a better version.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kenney

customer_reviews.title: HANDY LITTLE THING
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE OUTLET SWIVEL PROTECTORS. i HAD BOUGHT ONE A YEAR OR SO AGO WHEN THEY WERE ADVERTISING ON TV. i SAW THESE ON AMAZON AND ORDERED MORE. VERY CONVENIENT THAT THEY LAY FLAT AGAINST THE WALL AND U CAN PUSH YOUR FURNITURE RIGHT AGAINST THEM
customer_reviews.author: Karen D. Allmon

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews, and I have always been very happy with my Amazon purchases, but this thing is a piece of junk. I purchased it to have more outlets in a brand new bedroom, totally gutted and remodeled (so it has new outlets). This thing will not plug in and stay plugged in. I tried it in another room and it barely plugged in, but still would not work. The electrcal prongs on this disappear into itself when you try to plug it in. So, it is totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Better than my previous 4-plug model
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well-built. Better than my previous 4-plug model. Although I had expected it to plug into a two outlet wall socket, enough power is delivered from the single connection. The swivel feature is very nice, I think that will be a must-have form anything similar I buy in the future.
customer_reviews.author: fwblover

customer_reviews.title: i like how you can move the plugs around to go ...
customer_reviews.text: i like how you can move the plugs around to go with the furniture. it helps a lot. a little bulky but not bad. especially for being able to plug in 6 things.
customer_reviews.author: danet cadwallader

customer_reviews.title: It's a handy plug.
customer_reviews.text: When you need to change the direction of the plugs from its normal orientation of perpendicular to the wall to parallel to the wall, this is the plug to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Rovira

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted and NEEDED!
customer_reviews.text: This is PERFECT for behind my bed. I have an electric blanket and this keeps the cords UNDER the bed and OUT of SIGHT! I am VERY pleased with this purchase! Does exactly what it's supposed to do. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase ever. I don’t recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.text: The product is not usable because it keeps falling down from the power outlet because of the weight. I don’t know why amazon sells these kind of productss.
customer_reviews.author: Swathi

customer_reviews.title: Great invention
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful gadget for putting behind a sofa or bed, or anywhere where you have cords going off to the left and the right. Or anyplace you need more outlets, actually, unless you need them all going in one direction, in which case you can get a multiple outlet on a cord.
customer_reviews.author: KS Granny

customer_reviews.title: Has to go in the outlet upside down??!!??!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little confused if this product is intended to go in the outlet upside down or if I just got a "defective" one. It has one metal and one plastic plug and can only fit upside down. This makes the writing upside down which if you are OCD will drive you crazy. I use it in the bathroom because I need to plug in a hair dryer, curling iron and straightener all with the huge bulky plugs. The fact that I can tilt these helps the three fit without getting in each other's way.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: What looked like a mess of plugs now looks neat and tidy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Louise Ann

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice product but he build does not allow it to completely go flat in the sideways direction but it still worked great behind our bed. Also larger plugs will not fit more than 2 per side depending on how big your plugs and orientation they may be in. But it still works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt_Retired_Gamer

customer_reviews.title: decent, but has problems.
customer_reviews.text: the product works as it should, but it isn't secured to the wall very well. if you unplug something out of the top plug, in my case, it will seem as if the entire product will fall off the wall.
customer_reviews.author: JustThatJacob

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the picture, I was able to arrange my plugs for the most optimal use of space. Some plugs still stick out, but this still seems more desirable than the multioutlet strip laying on the floor. My only complaint is that is took over two months from my order time to delivery time.
customer_reviews.author: Bookshelf

customer_reviews.title: Great item. I have a lot of kitchen appliances ...
customer_reviews.text: Great item. I have a lot of kitchen appliances as I do a lot of cooking. I don't have that many electric outlets in the kitchen to make my appliance use convenient. This outlet server gives me the flexibility I need.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: can come out from outlet very easily
customer_reviews.text: its good product but it can easily come out from the outlet. wish it was thicker so it fits perfectly and steady when plugged in, instead of being so loosed.
customer_reviews.author: Rexburg guy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Item is cheaply made. Does not stay on wall properly and poses a hazard.
customer_reviews.author: j.l

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Swivels work great. Keeps wires along the wall instead of poking out. That being said I have one beef. The unit has only ONE ACTIVE set of prongs going into your outlet. The other is plastic and just helps stabilize the unit. You've just lost half of your outlet power. So if you actually used all six outlets it would put quite a load on the one active that it is plugged into. I have inexpensive 'surge protectors' that do a similar thing. Long story short, I feel comfortable putting lamp, radio, a couple charging devices and that's about it. I hope this makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Space saving Surge Protector
customer_reviews.text: This works great behind the headboard in our bedroom and allows me to push it back against the wall. Wonderful concept. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A must have for your entertainment center
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a great addition to my living room electrical outlets. I can now push my TV stand closer to the wall since the power cables are now parallel to the wall instead of perpendicular to it. I wish I had picked the one with USB connectors so I could just plug my chromecast to USB instead of to a power adapter.
customer_reviews.author: E. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Really like the design
customer_reviews.text: I have to concur with quite a few of the reviews. This unit tends to lean forward when plugged in and in my case the ground connector makes a very sketchy contact. sometimes the green light is on and sometimes off. Really like the design, they just failed to completely execute it. I expect this will get worse with use instead of better...back she goes. btw customer service is about as good as the ground connection...like the french though.
customer_reviews.author: erpa

customer_reviews.title: Versatile either way!
customer_reviews.text: This is a Great Wall adapter I can now push my appliances closer to the wall and not have a problem. I’m very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marty R.

customer_reviews.title: Globe Electric Swivel Outlet really works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: Really convenient for those odd shaped specialty plugs. Have it set up exactly as it looks in the picture with the plug panel at about 45 degrees. The previous 6 outlet plug I had only could accept 5 of my electronics plugs (one outlet covered up by the large size of my electronics plug), but the Globe 6 outlet allows me to plug in all 5 of my electronics plugs and leaves one to spare! The two adjustable swivel outlets really make a difference when using those odd sized eletronics/transformer plugs. Think I'll order a couple more of them! Totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: My favorite surge protector outlet.
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot. This is the 2nd one I've bought. The fact that the plugs rotate a bit were very helpful in installing it in a tight spot. And now I can move my heavy dresser back closer to the wall in spite of all the lamp, television, cable box, dvd player stuff that's plugged in back there. The other one is in my kitchen behind my toaster oven and mixer where the plugs take up less space up front than if they were plugged right into the wall outlet. Nice product! Would definitely recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: SGG

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: I like the swivel feature on the outlets. It is a bit thick and sticks out from the wall but I don't think it is much if any deeper than other adapters.
customer_reviews.author: Joel R.

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected! So many choices out there... this one, while a dollar or two more than other great options.... it surely stands up in value! Honestly, I think it's worth more than the price so... buy it now before they listen to my post and up the price! ha!
customer_reviews.author: Ladylily

customer_reviews.title: Mine doesn't pull out of the wall.
customer_reviews.text: I posted this as I saw a lot of criticism about the unit pulling out from the wall. This one has the metal prongs on the top, but it has a quality plastic prong on the bottom, so when you plug it in, you have a very sturdy unit. All sorts of plugs of various weights have been plugged in and no problem. Plus, this one has a power surge protection, which I proved once when I plugged in a heater with some other heavy duty appliances. It protected the circuit even before it got to the circuit breaker. If you need multiple plugs in one location, this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Keith

customer_reviews.title: Using it in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: I only have 2 outlets in my kitchen by the counter so this has been SUCH a big help in plugging everything in. Everything is working and no fuses have blown so I'm very happy!
customer_reviews.author: LISA

product_meta.title: 6-Outlet Space Saver Swivel Surge Protector Wall Adapter Tap, Grounded Outlets, White Finish,7732001
product_meta.description:
Color:WhiteEveryone needs a smart way to plug-in home electronics and Globe Electric's Original Space Saving 6-Outlet Swivel Surge Protector Wall Adapter Tap is the answer to your needs! Two 90-degree rotating sides allows six items to be pluged in and then moved so your couch, chair or bed can sit right against the wall. Plus, you can make sure everything is potected against a power surge with the two indicator lights - a red light is on when everything is being surge protected and a green light is on when all items are grounded. This is a case where the red light is a good thing! Perfect to use with your computer, printer, smartphone, tablet, home theatre system, lamps and more, you'll never need another tap.

AMAZON.COM
Designed for home theatres, this space-saving Globe surge protector features a compact swivel design that sits discreetly behind furniture and appliances. Rated for 2100 joules, which means it absorbs a high amount of energy, this safety device also provides 5Star protection. Two indicator display lights clearly alert you of the current power status and ongoing surge protection, so you can rest assured that your expensive home electronics are protected.

 This surge protector comes with a limited connected equipment warranty covering up to $300,000.
feature_bullets: SPACE SAVING SWIVEL DESIGN: the space saving swivel design is ideal for indoor use, tidying up cords in your home and office, and helps your furniture sit flat against your wall
SURGE PROTECTED: protects up to 2100 joules - for use with larger electronics such as computers, printers, smartphones and tablets, and home theater systems
INDICATOR DISPLAY LIGHTS: two indicator display lights alert you of the current power status and ongoing surge protection
UL RATED WITH 5-STAR PROTECTION: UL rated w/ 5 star protection to ensure the safety of your electronics. Total Outlet: 6
WARRANTY: comes with 2-year surge protector warranty protecting up to $300, 000 on connected equipment

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,123 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
